title: Module 5 Assessment
description: Test your understanding of innovation pathways under the AI Act.

questions.question: When must Member States have AI regulatory sandboxes operational?
questions.explanation: Article 57 requires Member States to ensure at least one regulatory sandbox is operational by August 2, 2026.

questions.question: Who gets priority access to regulatory sandboxes?
questions.explanation: Article 57 requires that regulatory sandboxes be accessible to SMEs and start-ups on a priority basis.

questions.question: What is required before real-world testing under Article 60?
questions.explanation: Article 60 requires informed consent from test participants, among other safeguards including authority approval or sandbox participation.

questions.question: What is the nature of codes of conduct under Article 95?
questions.explanation: Article 95 codes of conduct are voluntary and encourage application of AI Act principles to non-high-risk AI systems.

questions.question: How are SME penalties treated under the AI Act?
questions.explanation: For SMEs and start-ups, the lower of the two penalty caps applies (€ amount vs turnover percentage), with proportionality considerations.

questions.question: What is a key benefit of regulatory sandbox participation?
questions.explanation: Sandboxes provide regulatory guidance before market entry, reducing uncertainty, but do not guarantee market access or exempt from compliance requirements.

questions.question: Which is NOT typically covered by codes of conduct?
questions.explanation: Codes of conduct are for voluntary good practices beyond legal requirements. Prohibited AI practices are banned by law and cannot be subject to voluntary codes.

questions.question: What is the best approach to balancing innovation and compliance?
questions.explanation: Building compliance into AI design from the start supports both innovation speed and regulatory readiness, and typically costs less than retrofitting compliance later.
